intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. subscaposa, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers with prominent black spots, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in well-drained soils in sunny locations. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed areas, making it a common weed in agricultural fields and along roadsides.
